questions.question: Help me with this, ………………….?
questions.description: After imperatives, will you is used to ask people to do things.

questions.question: Politics ……………………… a dirty game.
questions.description: Words like politics, science and mathematics are singular.

questions.question: The girls in this photo ………………………….. my cousins.
questions.description: Here the subject is the plural noun girls.

questions.question: I …………………………. my grandparents yesterday.
questions.description: To call on is to visit.

questions.question: Neither of these answers ………………………….. correct.
questions.description: Use a singular verb after either and neither.

questions.question: I ……………………….. in Mumbai at that time.
questions.description: Use the simple past to talk about a completely finished event or situation.

questions.question: My application …………………………… by the company.
questions.description: In the simple past, the passive form is made with was/were + past participle form of the verb.

questions.question: I am writing a novel. A novel …………………………….. by me.
questions.description: The passive form of the present continuous is made with is/am/are + being + past participle.

questions.question: Let’s …………………………….. your plans.
questions.description: Discuss is one of those verbs that cannot be followed by a preposition.

questions.question: That child …………………………….. neither of his parents.
questions.description: Resemble does not take a preposition.

questions.question: We ……………………………. to hear from them for a long time.
questions.description: The present perfect continuous is used to talk about an action or situation that started in the past and has continued up to the present.

questions.question: I ………………………….. all my life in India.
questions.description: The present perfect is more appropriate here.
